tools.yolo package¶

Submodules¶

tools.yolo.preprocessing module¶

tools.yolo.preprocessing.check_yolo_txt(image_path: str)¶

Opens a new window showing the image and the boxes found in the corresponding yolo txt file. yolo txt file must be in the same folder as the image.

Parameters

image_path (str) – path to the image

tools.yolo.preprocessing.clean_via_file(via_file: str) → str¶

Cleans annotation csv file from via to differentiate the separators “,” from the actual “,” Returns the path to the clean csv file .

Parameters

via_file (str) – path to the via csv file

Returns

path to the clean csv file

Return type

str

tools.yolo.preprocessing.convert_via_to_yolo(via_file: str, out_dir: str, blurring: bool = False, noise: bool = False)¶

Downloads the images annotated in the via csv file and creates one txt file / image with the class and coordinates of the boxes as per yolo input format :

<object-class> <x> <y> <width> <height>

Parameters

  • via_file (str) – path to the via csv file

  • out_dir (str) – path to the outputs directory

  • blurring (bool) – if True, original data is augmented with a random blurring

  • noise (bool) – if True, original data is augmented with a random noise

tools.yolo.preprocessing.cut_overlength(center: float, length: float) → tuple[float, float]¶

Trims a box in case it goes outside of the image and returns the new coordinates of the center and length.

Parameters

  • center (float) – coordinate (x or y) of the box center

  • length (float) – width or height of the box

Returns

new values of the center and of the length

Return type

tuple[float, float]

tools.yolo.preprocessing.get_image_names(clean_via_file: str) → list[str]¶

Returns a list of the image file names annotated in the cleaned via file given as input.

Parameters

clean_via_file (str) – path to the via csv file cleaned with the clean_via_file function

Returns

list of the image file names

Return type

list[str]
